description: Detects execution of renamed version of PAExec. Often used by attackers
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
Jason Lynch
false_positives: Weird admins that rename their tools
Software companies that bundle PAExec with their software and rename it, so that it is less embarrassing
When executed with the "-s" flag. PAExec will copy itself to the "C:\Windows\" directory with a different name. Usually like this "PAExec-[XXXXX]-[ComputerName]"
name: Renamed PAExec Execution
query: (((winlog.event_data.Description:"PAExec Application") OR (winlog.event_data.OriginalFileName:"PAExec.exe") OR (Product:*PAExec*) OR (winlog.event_data.Imphash:("11D40A7B7876288F919AB819CC2D9802" OR "6444f8a34e99b8f7d9647de66aabe516" OR "dfd6aa3f7b2b1035b76b718f1ddc689f" OR "1a6cca4d5460b1710a12dea39e4a592c")) OR (winlog.event_data.Hashes:(*IMPHASH\=11D40A7B7876288F919AB819CC2D9802* OR *IMPHASH\=6444f8a34e99b8f7d9647de66aabe516* OR *IMPHASH\=dfd6aa3f7b2b1035b76b718f1ddc689f* OR *IMPHASH\=1a6cca4d5460b1710a12dea39e4a592c*))) AND (NOT ((process.executable.text:"*\\paexec.exe") OR (process.executable.text:"C\:\\Windows\\PAExec\-*"))))
